intro: Racosperma sessilispicum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has small, sessile leaflets that are arranged in pairs along the stems. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Racosperma sessilispicum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
